content:
That's great to hear! Taking a workshop is an excellent way to learn from experienced ceramicists and get hands-on practice with different glazing techniques. It's even more impressive that you've been experimenting with different glaze combinations and seeing progress.

Learning about the different types of glazes and how to mix them is a crucial part of mastering glazing. There are so many variables to consider, from the type of clay body to the specific chemicals and materials used in the glaze. It can be overwhelming at first, but with practice and patience, you'll develop a deeper understanding of how to achieve the effects you want.

What specific techniques or effects did you learn about in the workshop? Were there any particular glaze combinations or materials that caught your attention?

Also, what kind of effects are you trying to achieve in your glazing? Are you looking for specific colors, textures, or surface treatments? Sharing your goals and experiences can help me provide more tailored advice and suggestions.
